intro: Euphrasia tatarica var. cebennensis, commonly known as the Siberian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Euphrasia tatarica var. cebennensis is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
